alert.note: Alert for Asotin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 11:59AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Washington, including the following counties, Asotin and Garfield. * WHEN...Through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rain and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. There is also the potential for flooding, mud slides, or debris flows on and below the Lick Creek burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
